ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: Return the data used to create the radial or elliptical profile of the source model (before any PSF convolution) for imaging data.

SYNTAX.LINE: get_source_prof( [id], [model=None, rstep=None, rmin=None, rmax=None, rlo=None, rhi=None, xpos=None, ypos=None, ellip=None, theta=None, group_counts=None, group_snr=None, recalc=True] )

DESC.PARA: The get_source_prof() command calculates the radial - or elliptical - profile of the source model of an imaging dataset and returns an object containing the values. The profile is defined by the existing model compenents, although it is possible to over-ride these values.
The model values used to calculate the profile are those before convolution by any PSF model. Please use the get_model_prof() command if you want to plot the convolved model values.
The routine can be loaded into Sherpa by saying:
The argument options are the same as for the prof_data() command - except that the overplot and label arguments are not supported - and are described in its ahelp page.

ROW.DATA: The lower-limits of the radial bins
The upper-limits of the radial bins
The calculated profile value (sum of model / area)
The label for the X axis
The label for the Y axis

DESC.PARA: Two profiles of the same model are calculated; d10 uses a signal-to-noise ratio of 10 and d20 a value of 20.

A profile is calculated and displayed for the dataset "src1". The bin edges from this are then used to create a profile for the dataset "src2", which is overlain on the first plot. Note that recalc is set to False in the call to get_source_prof() to avoid unnescessary re-calculations.
